Reviews.Title: “A rat hole”
Reviews.Author: Florian300
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel, disgusting rooms and terribly bad staff. Breakfast in a very small room, where it is impossible to welcome more than 8 guests at the same time. Bathroom looks like a battlefield and the stains on walls, carpet, tv, fridge, door etc are the decor and the pride of the hotel. I would never go there even if it would be the only hotel in whole Rome.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: swong1709
Reviews.Content: Even with the bad reviews, we chose this hotel due to its proximity to the Termini station/metro BUT the quadruple room is so tiny that there is hardly any space to move (you also need to climb up 3 flights of stairs with luggage). You need to pay for the air conditioning (no mention anywhere when you book or on their website) and there is no warm/hot water for the showers. When we told the reception about it, he gave us a crap excuse about the water tank (obviously no hot water even in the afternoon when it’s not crowded). The hair-dryer is damaged and the drain is blocked – can’t shower for more than 10 minutes. The door of the fridge doesn’t close properly so it never stays cool and there is only one socket in the entire room (There is one next to the sink but how can you charge your phone there?). Internet is also unreliable. Overall, there are many hotels nearby– don’t let them trick you with their ‘garden’ or ‘friendly service’ (total nonsense from their website) – STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL. Most importantly, shame on the people who grade the hotels in Rome – how in the world can this hotel be 3 stars? No lobby; the reception is just a desk along with all the stuff I mentioned above. The ‘star system’ in Europe is a joke!!!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler52
Reviews.Content: With out going into great detail, let me just say that this is without a doubt the worst place I have ever considered staying. I didn't actually stay there.... After being yelled at by the desk clerk and climbing 3 flights of stairs to find our room, which turned out to be gloomily dark, without air conditioning, smelling of mold and just plain disgusting, we left the hotel and got a much nicer room at a much lower rate elsewhere. We had never reserved a room at this hotel. We booked a room online at Hotel Urbis. When we got there, they did not have our room and said that they had reserved us a room at Hotel Pavia.... Long story short, I think the two hotels were working together on some kind of bait and switch scam. My advise is to steer clear of both hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Compared to other options, not bad”
Reviews.Author: phillipsrhit
Reviews.Content: If you want an American style hotel room, don't stay here. If you want a cheap, no frills Italian hotel room, this isn't too bad. Parking was handy and they let us leave our car there most of the second day of our stay for free. Only a few rooms have A/C and in the heat of the summer, you may want this (surcharge) as the hotel gets pretty hot. The free breakfast wasn't too bad; only complaint was no fruit at all. Proximity to Termini and both Metro lines is handy. A decent very cheap option in Rome. The rooms are outdated. The staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!!”
Reviews.Author: DanielMartina
Reviews.Content: The hotel would be ok for a different price. But for the price it charges it is very very bad. The blanket had little holes and bloodstains on it. The bathroom is not really a bathroom. It is a toilet with a bidet, a washbasin....and then there is a sprinkler coming out of the wall in between the washbasin and the toilet. It is not possible to use the shower curtain, because it stinks and it the space is so small that you strike at it with every move. There is also no shower tray - thats why after having a shower the whole bathroom is under water (approx. 2 cm). The rooms stink - so you have to leave open the window all the time. There are stains on the wall - from former damages by water. The breaktfast is awful - it is not as nice as you would expect it from the homepage!!! The service is ok. The location of the hotel is ok - it is near to metro and the train station termini - but in the neighbourhood there are quite a lot of homeless people - and it stinks like urine when you go the the hotel.....especially when it is warm outside. So please don't go there! Believe us it is not worth the money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: lippmana
Reviews.Content: This was without a doubt the worst hotel experience of my life. I have never stayed in a place so terrible. Even though we paid for air conditioned rooms, the hotel did not honor our reservation. The rooms were tiny and hot and we could not even open the window because of drunk people breaking bottles outside. In addition the bathrooms were so small that you actually had to shower on the toilet. I've never seen anything like it. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but close to train station, free internet and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: kspeer09
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent, I was looking for boutique budget, with a central location. The room was up 2 flights with a small balcony. The shower was in the middle of the small bath. You had to wrap the curtain around you. Clean but worn. Good cold breakfast and nice small bar. Lots of local shops, laundry and cafes nearby. Also walk to the hop on hop off bus tour, a gorgeous fountain a block behind the hotel. Must qualify the right people for the stay here. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pavia??? Forget this one!!!”
Reviews.Author: sleCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We were warned to avoid but due to the proximity to the train station and an early departure the next morning we took a chance and booked. A 3 star rating so we were not expecting "luxury." However, room barely held two twin beds, worn and stained carpeting, the shower flooded the whole bathroom--drain in the middle of the floor no less. Fortunately we spent only a few hours to catch some sleep but "escaped" at the break of dawn.. Far overpriced with no ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Never go to Pavia Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: zero100
Reviews.Content: We had reserved, through a tourist agent in Greece, two quadruple rooms for three nights and the official internet site of the hotel (www.hotelpavia.it) promised a joyful and nice stay. Unfortunately when we entered the hotel and the rooms on 17/07/2008, we faced a different situation. It was the most dirty and uncomfortable room we had ever seen! The dirty black wallpapers, the stained floor carpets, the tearing towels like rags, the cracked ceilings, the mould wardrobes, the broken and uncovered lightings and the webs of spiders hanging from the ceilings were really disappointed us during the most important part of our trip in Italy. In addition, the space among the beds was extremely restricted for quadruple rooms and the toilet was separated from the room with a drawn door which did not entirely close. The antennas of the televisions were broken, some of the sockets did not work and the drain system in the toilet was blocked. We were also really surprised when the reception stuff offered us the air condition for an additional rate of 13 euros per day (!!!!). There is no doubt that we had to leave such a hotel immediately… but we were obliged to pay 13 euros per car (!!!) for using the hotel parking place for 4 hours, until we find the proper hotel for us. So never go to Pavia Hotel! Never…

Reviews.Title: “Pass up the Pavia it's rotten!”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool200808
Reviews.Content: I went to the hotel Pavia in 2008 for my birthday. The first room I was put in was so dirty and grimey with a toilet that was practically inside the tiny shower. I complained immediately and demanded another room. I was moved the following day onto another dirty room with a tiny bathroom where I could shower, use the toilet and sink at the same time. I also came away with a 'skin disease' from my stay in this hotel. I came out in a red rash all over my legs on my 3rd day there, this spread up the whole of my body, my GP said she wasn't sure what it was but it was a fungal skin infection of sorts and I'd caught it from somewhere 'dirty'. I can assure you the only 'dirty' place I went to was the Hotel Pavia. DO NOT GO THERE, IT'S A NIGHTMARE AND WILL SPOIL YOUR STAY IN ROME.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: barnetts117
Reviews.Content: Arrived with my niece to be greeted by sweaty looking receptionist, shown to room on request. TINY, dirty and smelly with 'balcony'/deathtrap. Ensuite consisted of dated toilet with 'shower' in v.close proximity to toilet (showerhead and dirty curtain = shower ). As it was late we had to stay the night but booked out at dawn without staying for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Chaged a lot”
Reviews.Author: Ninzo
Reviews.Content: i think first and foremost it is important to read new reviews of a A hotel. i have stayed in this hotel on two occasions- the first time being 5 years ago and again very recently the changes are amazing - the hotel is now very clean and tidy, They have obviously spent a lot of time doing this place up The showers are nice and hot and very clean, the breakfast is prompt and served with a smile Ok, So this is not the Ritz but it is a friendly, Warm and welcoming little B&B with a central location I have found the staff very eager to help you and their english has certainly improved since the last time i was there I would recommend this little hotel to anyone wanting to spend a short break in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Pavia the briill hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fourteen-7
Reviews.Content: A group of 14 came for the rugby,7 couples we checked in to the very cleanhotel where nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The linen was changed daily, the breakfast was excellent. It felt like home from home, would definately recommend it for anyone visiting the city, it is near the termini and you are able to see the sites. Easy acsess to all areas.!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pass up the Pavia”
Reviews.Author: Terry52Brisbane
Reviews.Content: I have to add my voice to the chorus of complaint about this hotel. My wife and I visited it for three days in January 2003 on a package deal advertised in CIT. Every negative comment in the Trip Advisor reviews was true for the Pavia then. My wife insisted that we find somewhere else after one night in the Pavia, although budget constraints forced us to witness the "fun" for the full three days. I think my favourite memory is of the morning that commenced with a cold shower and the disintegration of the concertina curtain to the bathroom, followed by a meagre breakfast doled out with Dickensian parsimony, when an American service man politely complained to stoney faced management about the fact that the toilet in his room lacked a seat. It is a case where "location, location location" does not cut it.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my god........................”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: "Try having a cold shower where the shower head sticks out of the wall, in a room the size of a wardrobe -you could sit on the loo, brush your teeth and have a cold shower at the same time, while getting tangled up in the soggy shower curtain." I laughed my "---" off when I read this. I just got back from this hole and coud not have said it better my self! I was going to discribe it as the true meaning of Shower and Shave, all without moving! My wife and I discussed going to another hotel and opted to stay the extra night at the Pavia so as not to loose valuble vacation time. Location made it very easy to get around but in the end it just sucked staying there! This should be a one star at best hotel. Do yourself a favor and don't, I repeat don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, but the bathroom......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pavia for two nights in Nov. I thought the staff was wonderful. The breakfast was served with a smile and it was nice to have the free internet to email our children. However, the bathroom was simply an accordian door separating the amenities. The toilet was literally three feet away from the bed. I don't think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dump with rude staff - and FRAUDULENT!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving they told me that they had overbooked the hotel and arranged for me to stay in another hotel for the 1st night and the 2nd night again in the Pavia. No excuses and no help with luggage. I had booked 2 months before but they did not bother to contact me about the overbooking till I actually showed up. Also no compensation offered and an absent manager (for 3 days!!). Staff was very rude when I did not want to pay for other hotel (Windrose - dump as well and filthy). Wanted me to pay full price for the 2 nights and said I should contact the manager if I wanted compensation. Told them manager can contact me if he wants to get paid. Had to deal with 3 different staff, each trying to get me to pay. I paid for 2nd night the afternoon before leaving after much trouble and being told they would prepare the bill. Each time after that they wanted me to sign a creditcard slip for 1st night. Last staff member was so rude he screamed into my face - not a nice way to treat a lady - when I told him I was not paying and if he processed the creditcard slip that I would report them for fraud. (I am a anti-fraud specialist). He also refused to give me the bill, which is illegal!!! How on earth did they get 3*??? Room was small but worse, it was dirty and filthy. Probably a reflection of the area. Termini - Latrini - Urini.... burrr!!!! Stay away. I will try to report them to the Rome tourist board.

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better”
Reviews.Author: fraz11
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a few hotels in italy and this was by far the worse. You can find much better (both location and amenities) for the same or less money.

Reviews.Title: “charge for air”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Talk of hidden charges. You pay an extra 30 euros to activate the a/c of your room on a hot summer day. Why bother with an hotel when you can get an oven for free in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: LAponte
Reviews.Content: Our experience of Hotel Pavia - good. Very clean, good value, great location. But bathrooms are too small. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “what an experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Easter'05, sharing a quadruple room with my Mum, Sister & niece.I've stayed in 5 other hotels in Rome & this was the smallest so far-the first thing that greets you on arrival is the mirrored reception area, with green flourescent lighting, which is a little disconcerting, especially when you've been up at 4.30 am! Our room didn't overlook the baths and was so small that we had to keep our cases under the beds & do a rota of opening them as there was no place to keep them. The breakfast facilities are inadequate-only 4 tables with seating for 3 persons for the whole hotel-in fact, we had our breakfast sitting at the bar one morning. Nights were spent listening to the rather noisy plumbing-the highlight of our stay was when the bathroom door got stuck & we had to ask the night porter to open it ( he couldn't!), so we had to use the toliet in the bar area. The best thing about the hotel is the proximity to the terminal, which is handy when you're pulling cases around, although I think I'd rather drag my case further rather than having the misfortune of having to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Sweet Smell Of Rome (!)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately a rather disapointing experiance in Hotel Pavia, the duvet had a ciggie burn in, the bathroom smelt terrible and the carpet was very stained. Not good value for money. Must say however that the staff were friendly and helpful but not enough to encourage me back ! The road reeked of urine and we had to do a mad dash to and from the hotel each day before we took the risk of inhaling !!

Reviews.Title: “SO disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not a nice place. Cold shower, rude night desk attendant and tiny, overpriced rooms. When my wife asked for some refreshments the desk attendant simply stared at her chest and said no. As I checked in a woman was complaining that her reservation had not been held as she was heading out the door looking for a place to stay.. in the rain. They did eventually get the water to be warm, but never hot. So sad to spend even part of a honeymoon in a dump like Hotel Pavia.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathrooms of the Pavia being small (which is par for the course in Europe, and not worth complaining about in my opinion), my friends and I adopted one of the two lounges as our own cozy parlor. The staff was pleasant and friendly for the most part, and the location near the Stazione Termini was extremely convenient. The view out our hotel room window was of Roman ruins and the rooftops of Rome. At sunset the starlings put on a spectacular flocking display that was like a fireworks of birds. (This sounds weird, but it was a high point of my Rome trip.) Diane

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pavia - disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MadelineAlbright
Reviews.Content: Beyond the convenient location and the nice view (from the rooms in the back) over the garden of the Diocletian Baths, I found the place very disappointing. I paid E90/night for a single with bath, no AC. Here are some comments that I have from my recent (June '03) stay: - the neighborhood is creepy rather than quiet. It's mostly deserted besides the occasional hooker and the drug dealers who hang out around the corner. - the street that the hotel is on smells like urine. it seems to be the spot in the area for men to relieve themselves. - the desk staff is brusque at best. twice, when I asked them for information (a phone number) staff members told me they were too busy to help me. - maybe my room missed the renovation? It was small and dingy, the bathroom was tiny with one of those "the whole room becomes the shower" things. - the hotel has acceptable, rather than "tasteful" decor I met another american family who booked on your reservation. They were so disappointed that they moved, sacrificing half their deposit.
